thread.title: Ex-Vol Kane Bemiller to be inducted into hall
thread.title_full: Ex-Vol Kane Bemiller to be inducted into hall

title: Ex-Vol Kane Bemiller to be inducted into hall
text:
Missy Kane Bemiller to be inducted into Tennessee Sports Hall of Fame Staff and wire reports 7:16 PM, Oct 24, 2015 Missy Kane Special to the News Sentinel   Show Caption Previous Next 
NASHVILLE â€” Missy Kane Bemiller, a former Olympian and former middle distance running standout at Tennessee, is bound for the Tennessee Sports Hall of Fame. 
Kane, who lives in Knoxville, will be inducted next summer as part of group that includes former Tennessee Titans quarterback Steve McNair. 
Kane won a bronze medal in the 1,500 at the 1983 Pan American Games and ran the same race at the 1984 Summer Games in Los Angeles. She's already been inducted into the Greater Knoxville Sports Hall of Fame and the Lady Volunteer Hall of Fame. 
The Tennessee Sports Hall of Fame announced Saturday that McNair would be inducted posthumously along with former high school golf coach King Oehmig on June 18 in Nashville. Former Tennessee football players Conrad Graham and Lester McClain, Southeastern Conference football official Mike Taylor, former Memphis and NFL wide receiver Earnest Gray, auto racing owner Mike Curb, sportswriter Joe Biddle and the Canale brothers also will be inducted that day. 
The Canale family of Memphis had six brothers who played SEC football at Tennessee or Mississippi State. 
The Hall of Fame also will honor former Milligan coach, athlete and athletic director Duard Walker as a lifetime achievement inductee.
